item.description:
It's almost that time of year again! Time for the drinking and the wearing of the green at the Harpoon St. Patrick's Festival.

From Harpoon:

-Kick off the St. Patrick's Day Holiday season in Harpoon style!
-What better place to begin the season than inside the largest brewery in Boston?!?!?!
-Food vendors selling Corned beef & cabbage along with other delicious food
-Cash bars offering a selection of fresh Harpoon and UFO beer featuring Celtic Ale
-Featuring live Irish and Rock and Roll bands from the Boston area
-Come dance the jig, enjoy Harpoon beer, and celebrate St. Patrick!

Where is it?
-At the Harpoon Brewery, 306 Northern Ave., Downtown Boston.
-Inside The Brewery amongst the tanks and outside under huge circus tents
-Free shuttles from the South Station area. Departs from behind the Federal Reserve along the Fort Point Channel off Summer Street. Look for the Shuttle Sign.

Band Schedule:

5:30 – 7:00 PM Dicey Riley (Celtic Rock and Irish Pub Songs)

7:30 – 8:00 PM Colum Cille Pipes & Drums (Bagpipes & all)

8:20 – 10:20 PM Joshua Tree (Boston’s Premiere U2 Cover Band)

More details:
-Cover charge $20.00 and includes a souvenir Pint Cup and one (1) drink ticket (does not include food or additional beers)
-Must be 21 or older and have proper I.D.
-Cash bars serving a selection of fresh Harpoon beer for $5.00 per 16 oz. cup

NOTE: FRIEND OF HARPOON FRIDAY NIGHT SPECIAL! Present your Friend of Harpoon Card, and you will receive HALF PRICE ADMISSION ($10 includes admission and one drink ticket)! You MUST have your Friend of Harpoon card to receive this price! If you don't have your Friend of Harpoon card, please request one on the Friend of Harpoon website. And if you are not a Friend of Harpoon, you can sign up on the website as well.

There's usually a coat check (a few $$) so you don't have to lug your coat, etc. around all night. Bathrooms are porta-potty's, so be prepared! Also, the food isn't THAT good, so eat something before hand or take a snack with you. There are a few food vendors inside south station if you want to grab something there.

**Like Susan, who has organized this event in the past, I recommend taking the T and leaving your car at home, especially if you're going to drink. Some even say that the beer is stronger than normal, since it comes fresh from the brewery.**

We will meet between 5:30 and 6:00 outside Clarke's. Then we'll head over using the shuttle. Please RSVP by 3pm on March 5th so I know who to look for at Clarke's. Maybe's will be considered a "No" at that point. Thanks! :)
item.name: Harpoon St. Patrick's Festival 2010
